dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Union Station, that gorgeous fifty-year-old monument to A Deco/California Mission architecture. Still beautiful. St grand. A sign at one of the departure/arrival gates in the main  concourse-says the "San Diegan", number 2 64, is due at 1 Set above the gates, a big clock - six feet in diameter.
We see the big hand slam into "7". A loudspeaker - you can just about understand this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amtrack 2 64, the San Diegan, from  San Diego, Del Mar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "San Diegan" pulls into the terminal and comes to a s grinding stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...San Clemente, San Juan Capistrano,  and Irvine is now arriving at Gate  Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors are opened. Steps set down. Passengers pour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amtrack 264 will be departing in  fifteen minutes from Gate Nine for  Oxnard, Ventura...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN and A WOMAN stand with a view of the arrival doors. He's a blue-collar tough guy, dressed for church. She's h beefy counterpart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Santa Barbara, Lompoc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUY (MR. SMITH) checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Santa Maria, San Luis Obispo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he looks up to the big clock. 12:07. The minute hand slams into the "8".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and points north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He resets his watch as DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS pour out o the gate. PEOPLE run forward with kisses and hugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand like a couple of rocks, their eyes scanning th crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  Hates his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're talking about a couple in their forties.  She  motormouths her way across the terminal and the husband  follows with the suitcases. WHOOSH! A couple of TEENAGE BOYS on rollerblades zip by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate rollerblades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train.. A PRETTY SIX-YEAR-OLD GIRL (LYNN) , who is ho a stuffed animal almost as large as she is, climbs down t steps. She reaches the platform, looks around. From withi the train:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn!  Lynn!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE WATSON, thirtyish, a regular Joe in appearance and  inclination, appears above, carrying a couple small suitc He takes a relieved breath when he sees  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, don't walk ahead of me, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he comes down the steps:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, honey. Don't get out of  my sight, all right? I want you to  stay right by me. Will you do that  for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods solemnly. GENE reaches the  platform and gives out an exaggerated  sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN nods back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! A SECURITY GUARD approaches the two ROLLERBLADING TEENS. They circle him, toss off a few taunts and roll aw laughing. MR. SMITH and MS. JONES continue trolling the PASSENGERS they come through the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skate-boarders I don't mind, even  though they dress like fuckin' idiots,  but when I see some pin-head on  rollerblades, I get the definite  urge to grease the grill of my car  with 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes peeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're talking about a COUPLE IN THEIR SIXTIES, warmly  greeting each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever had an idea it would die  of malnutrition. First those blue  hairs then some Spic.  Leave this to  me. I know people. It's my job. I'm  a people person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH laughs at his joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH has spotted someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking towards the exit gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE has emerged with LYNN. They pause there, getting the bearings. Next to them, a YOUNG COUPLE is kissing. They c keep their hands off each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta make a phone call, Lynn. Do  you see a phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN has seen the YOUNG COUPLE. She secretly points to th covers her mouth, and does a "tee, hee, hee" number. GENE laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking across the concourse, towards MR. SMIT and MS. JONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LYNN) Haven't you ever seen anybody kiss  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never saw your Mom and me kiss  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN suddenly gets very sad. She looks at the ground, slo down. GENE notices. He stops, crouches down to her level. MR. SMITH and MS. JONES, nearing them, split apart, move  around them, and keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LYNN) Hey, it's OK to talk about her. You  can talk about her all you want. You  know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, come on. You never saw us kiss  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you see us kiss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN gives her own hand a little peck of a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? That little peck of a  kiss? Oh, brother, you missed some  kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN laughs and throws herself on her dad. He holds her t him, looks to the sky for help.. He finds himself staring the big clock. 12:10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, I'm gonna be late. I gotta call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH and MS. JONES are making a beeline for their ta the YOUNG KISSING COUPLE. WHOOSH! The-ROLLERBLADING TEENS almost collide with them. MS. JONES wants to do something about it, but MR. SMITH p her along. They have a mission to complete. They close in the couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at 'em. He'd do anything for  her.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple are murmuring sweet talk between kisses. The w themselves are unclear until MR. SMITH and MS. JONES are  only a few feet away. French. They are speaking French. M SMITH makes an instant one-eighty turn. MS. JONES follows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Foreigners! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frogs. They copy our blue jeans and  when we need their help in Kuwait,  where the fuck are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH looks at the partner he's been saddled with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE has found a pay phone. He keeps an eye on LYNN who h wandered a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, is Mr. Conners there? I have  an interview with him at twelve- thirty. Hi, Mr. Conners, this is  Gene Watson. Sorry to call you at  the last minute like this but...  Hey, hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reacts to the ROLLERBLADING TEENS who swoop past LYNN, one on each side, too close for a father's comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch that! Lynn, come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. He keeps an eye on the TEENS, who, having found victim, are circling around, passing MR. SMITH and .MS. J MR. SMITH has noticed GENE. GENE at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. There's some crazy kids on  skates. Listen, the train just got  in, I'm afraid I'm going to be a few  minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEENS make their pass, flip him the bird, engage in o objectionable behavior, begin to circle again. MR. SMITH  watches GENE watch the TEENS, then notice a sturdy, sand- filled ashtray next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. OK, I'll get there as soon as  I can. Bye, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Keeping one eye on the circling TEENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LYNN) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let' s do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a suit-case and accidently-on-purpose uses it knock over the ashtray, just as the TEENS approach. The  ashtray spills its Load of sand into their path. When the hit it, their skates stop, they don't. They sprawl, doing nasty things to knees and wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands over them with LYNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, see, this is why you should  always wear a helmet and knee pads.  You never know when you're going to  fall down and go boom. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not so sure) Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows. They intercept GENE. MR. SMITH flashes a bad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I see some identification,  sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ditto with the badge) I.D. Could we see some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sure. What's, what's the problem?  Will a driver's license do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE pulls out his wallet, surprised and confused. MR. SM looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about those kids? Look, I'm  sorry about that. But they darn  near...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're from Santa Maria, Mr. Watson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near Lompoc, north. What's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cause a ruckus, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls open his coat, putting his hands on his hips, no so coincidentally revealing the butt of a holstered gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to cause a ruckus,  with the little girl and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES swoops LYNN up and heads for the station entran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I'll take the girl. I'll take  the girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. She's good with kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE hurries after MS. JONES. MR. SMITH grabs up the  suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES nears a souvenir stand. The OWNER is looking th other way. Without breaking stride, MS. JONES reaches out snatches a child's coloring book and crayons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. I confiscated it.  There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're out the door, GENE hurrying after. The big ha on the big clock moves. 12:12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES heads for-a van with smoked windows. She gets i with LYNN. GENE stops a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH prods him in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the van, Mr. Watson. Front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks desperately around for help. There is none. He lets MR. SMITH push him toward the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN and MS. JONES are in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get your seatbelt on. Always  gotta wear your seatbelt, isn't that  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE climbs into the front passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your daddy. See? We're your  daddy's friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH climbs into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The policeman is your  friend. Isn't that right, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks down. MR.. SMITH has pulled his gun. He points casually so it's aiming through the seat in the general  direction of the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's OK, Lynn. These are our  friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, would you look at this crazy  car? Everybody has their own radio.  What do you think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. And you can listen to it without  anybody else listening. Let's try it  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts some ear phones on her. She holds up the plug-in end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what they call the jack. Hi,  Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes in that little hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plugs the jack in. MS. JONES turns on the radio. LYNN gets a big smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) It's loud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to work, playing with the radio, changing statio etc., oblivious to all else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Removes a Pro Label Machine from  under the seat. She begins to type  in several characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get down to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? You're not the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS JONES presses PRINT on the Labeller. A strip of plasti emerges that she begins to apply to a Name Tag.  He looks back to her. MR. SMITH whacks him on the knee with the gu It hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention, Mr. Watson. Pay  attention and your daughter won't be  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back. She is caressing LYNN's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a move. MR. SMITH whacks his knee again, harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Watson, you're not paying  attention. Your daughter's life  depends on you. Do you understand  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks from MR. SMITH to MS. JONES and back. He's hav a hard time focussing. She slips the NameTag into a manila envelope beside her M SMITH Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the manila envelope from MS JONES, tosses it in  GENE'S lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you. In it there is a  picture of a woman and an itinerary.  It is her itinerary. She is presently -  are you listening, Mr. Watson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is presently at the Bonaventure  Hotel. That's right near here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures. GENE looks. The glassy Bonaventure Hotel is  glimpsed surrounded by taller, newer high-rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you leave this van you will get  yourself a cab and take it to the  Bonaventure Hotel. Then you will  take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH holds up his hand, snaps his fingers. From the  back, MS. JONES hands him a cloth-wrapped bundle. He puts in GENE's hand, shows him what it is: a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you will kill the woman whose  picture is in there. Not just shoot  her, mind,! kill her. I'd recommend  you empty the gun into her. Close  up. Got all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a moment for it all to sink into GENE'S brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will do no such thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you will, Mr. Watson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "snap!" from the back seat. GENE looks. MS. JONES has b a carrot stick. She breaks another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We'll take good care of  the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives half the carrot stick to LYNN, pops the other h in her mouth and grinds it to pulp. MR. SMITH is checking his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now 12:16. If the woman in the  picture is alive at 1:30... (holds up a walkie- talkie) ...I call my partner, your daughter  is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in the rear-view mirror to MS. JONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens if I don't call  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kill her anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that, Mr. Watson? Do  you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps the manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman in the picture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the back seat with his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...or your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH reaches over, puts the gun and manila envelope  into GENE'S pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God can't help her, Mr. Watson. Only  you can help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches across GENE, opens the door and pushes him out then follows him. LYNN takes off the ear-phones, tries to undo her seatbelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my daddy going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES wraps a big arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to help the police. Your  daddy is going to be a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy is going to be a hero? Like  Power Rangers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like Power Rangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH activates the walkie-talkie, speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's test this thing. You on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds it up for GENE to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Reading you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH still has GENE'S wallet. He opens it, pulls out some cash, puts it in GENE's breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'11 need some cash. (re: the wallet) I'll hang onto this for the time  being. Oh, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs one of GENE's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dumps six bullet's into GENE's palm from a cloth Chiva Regal bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get moving, Mr. Watson. Time's a  wastin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE just stands there, transfixed by the bullets in his  hand. MR. SMITH reaches out, turns him around and gives h a shove away from the van and into the midst of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a LARGE CROWD OF TOURISTS, that have just exited an  arriving mini-bus. GENE is caught up in the crowd and car along like a leaf in a stream. Amid the chattering CROWD, GENE is pushed along as if in trance. He touches the pocket with the gun. He looks at t Bullets in his hand, then at the people around him. It's  like a splash of cold water. He quickly pockets the bulle turns and pushes against the tide of tourists. They resis him, pushing him along until he breaks free and can see.. The van is gone!

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: He stands there, a lost man. Fear sweeps over him. He loo desperately around. He is within himself, oblivious to hi surroundings, his mind racing, his face a tangle of emoti He is a man alone in a crowd. He takes a step. A LITTLE LATINO GIRL, chased by HER BROTHER, runs into GE legs. He instinctively grabs her before she can fall, fin himself, crouched down, holding her by the arms. His hear plunges - she isn't Lynn. His intensity scares her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away, flees to HER MOTHER, who hoists her up,  reprimanding her in Spanish. GENE stays crouched, watchin the LITTLE GIRL staring at him over HER MOTHER'S shoulder Until a COP crosses his line of sight. A LOS ANGELES TRAN POLICEMAN, foot-patrolling the station. It's like a gift from above. Relief floods GENE's face. H is saved. He stands, hurries toward the COP, each step mo confident. Then, just beyond the COP, MR. SMITH casually slides into view, pointedly holding the walkie-talkie. GENE walks rig past the COP heading towards a cab stand. MR. SMITH falls behind him speaking in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to a cop, you even look at  a cop too long and your daughter is  dead. (into walkie-talkie) Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Go ahead, sugar Die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Lynn calling Daddy. Lynn calling  Daddy. Come in, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE grabs at the walkie-talkie like a drowning man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I can hear you good. Can you hear  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, I can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) 'Daddy has to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) He has to say "over and out". Daddy,  you have to say "over and out".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH clicks off the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your watch. Look at it! At  one-thirty your little girl is dead.  Say it with me. At one-thirty my  little girl is dead. Say it. Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) At one thirty my little girl is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you do what you're told. Go  do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes GENE on, toward a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget I'll be watching  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks back at him, full of impotent rage. MR. SMITH  raises the walkie-talkie. GENE reaches the first cab at t stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CABBIE, talking to ANOTHER DRIVER, throws away his  cigarette, ambles over to the Driverside-of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bonaventure. The Bonaventure  Hotel. Do you know where that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CABBIE is disappointed, but he nods and GENE gets int the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CABBIE gets in and they take off. GENE stares at the  manila envelope in his hand. He starts to open it, is sto by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amtrack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just come in on Amtrack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business or pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, San Diego? I've thought about  moving to San Diego.  It's hard to  make a living in this town. These  short hops.  Can't make a dime on  'em. To LAX, Pasadena, then I can  make a buck. These little hops cost  me money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'S okay. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better in San Diego? More opportunity  there? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't know. I don't live  there. I was just visiting...a grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lapse into silence. GENE starts to open the envelope again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grave. Somebody close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wife. Ex-wife. Almost ex. We were  separated. She was thinking about a  divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE notices the dashboard clock - 12:22 GENE leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...I've... I've got a problem. A  big problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the horn and swerves to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Watch it, buddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks out his window and finds himself staring at MR SMITH, staring back at him, driving the van, next to him. throws himself back in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls into the drive front of the Bonaventure Hot and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to hear about your problem,  but the ride's over. Three-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks out the back window, watches the van pulls up the curb on the other side of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-fifty. I hope your problem  doesn't have anything to do with my  three-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks back at the CABBIE, waiting for his fare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE digs through his pockets and comes up with one of hi business cards. He hurriedly writes on it: "HELP. VAN KID CHILD." He wraps a five around it, pushes it into the CAB hand, gives him a meaningful look and gets out of the cab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE stops a few yards from the cab, watching the CABBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CABBIE finds the secreted card, but looks at the wron side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I want with an accountant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOORMAN leans down at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one for the airport. You free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORMAN plants a PASSENGER in the cab. As he pulls aw the CABBIE again glances at the business card, crumples i up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE watches the cab leave. As it exits, the CABBIE's arm snakes out and tosses the card in the trash. GENE knows w it is. He looks around. VALETS, BELLMEN, ARRIVALS and DEPARTEES, cars coming and  going. No one pays particular attention to him. GENE looks at the van across the street. MR. SMITH gets o and walks across the street towards him. The van drives a GENE watches the van disappear around the corner, despera hanging onto the last glimpse of it. MR. SMITH takes the walkie-talkie out of his pocket. GENE goes into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE enters. It's like another world. A busy, humming, ai conditioned planet. PEOPLE hustle around the restaurants, waterfalls - a definite ant farm ambiance.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Suddenly we have cut to a VIDEO IMAGE of Gene looking aro this Hotel, complete with scrolling TIME AND DATE. Shot b someone high above.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: GENE is bumped and buffeted about by the bustling crowd. breaks free to a clear spot, looks up and freezes. Then h starts tracking all around him, seeing...something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He desperately fumbles in his pocket. Facing and above him, some WORKMEN ON LADDERS are securin huge, rolled up banner. GENE finds what he's looking for - the manila envelope. H rips it open. As he pulls out the photograph that is insi the WORKMEN let their banner unfurl. We do a simultaneous reveal. The woman in the photograph in the envelope is th same as depicted on the banner. Written across the bottom it in your best red, white, and blue: "RE-ELECT ELEANOR SAMARA GRANT GOVERNOR"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And an addendum:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dawns on him. He looks around him again. This time we what he sees. Campaign posters and banners everywhere.  On some of them she is posed with a handsome man, several years her junior. These have the caption, "Governor Grant and husband Brendan".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweet Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes fall on MR. SMITH, standing inside the entrance, walkie-talkie in hand, watching him. GENE looks at a poster, at MR. SMITH, who smiles, nods an gives GENE a move of the head - "Get to it." GENE shoves the photograph away as if it could incriminat him, then slides out the itinerary. The itinerary says "California Educators' Association - 1 noon - Emerald Bay Room - Opening Address - Governor Elea Samara Grant". GENE checks his watch. 12:26. He looks around him at the confusion and spots a Bellboy, GUSTINO, who's cleaning out ashtrays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you tell me where the Emerald  Bay Room is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUSTINO points up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third floor. Yellow stairwell. Follow  the signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE turns away without a word, starts to walk, then turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks. Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUSTINO smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE mounts a set of stairs that will take him to the thi floor. MR. SMITH follows him as he climbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole lobby and entrance of the hotel are seen as Gen ascends. GENE forces himself not to look at MR. SMITH behind him. nerves are rising in anticipation of his destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE sees the arrow and sign for the Emerald Bay Room.  H walks that way. MR. SMITH follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE and MR. SMITH pass gift shops, snack bars. The walkw is crowded and GENE is going against the tide of REPORTER POLITICIANS, SUPPORTERS, and just a lot of PEOPLE WITH NA TAGS. GENE plows on through... ...and runs smack into BRENDAN GRANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Whoops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men reel back from each other. A SECURITY MAN,  earphones and gray suit, steps immediately between them.  BRENDAN GRANT is a charmingly smooth man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice body check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues on, talking to an ATTRACTIVE WCMAN COMPANION BRENDAN GRANT What the Governor really admires, Mrs. Went and Eleanor has said this to me on more than one occasion are pecple like you who take a personal tragedy and turn into a positive force. He slides a familiar hand around her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my wife has a deeply personal  reason for going after repeat drunk  drivers. They are felons and they  should be treated as such. A drivers  license is a privilege, not a right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he is hustled away. Right past an election poster  featuring him and Governor Grant. Still stunned by the encounter, GENE turns back and watch the Governor's husband, but keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is emptying, that's where the crowd came from. GENE co in. A WOMAN is heading for the door with a centerpiece she's  just copped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, is the...thing over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You didn't miss much. The  food...chicken again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor Grant is gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Nice speech. But it's the same  at all these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But GENE has turned away. The WOMAN gives him a face, gra another centerpiece and exits. A CLEAN-UP CREW is startin to go through the room. GENE leans against a wall, breath through a combination of relief and agony. MR. SMITH is suddenly next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check your itinerary. Move along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE gets out the itinerary. "12:30 - 12:45 - Hors d'oeuv Buffet w/Friends of Eleanor Samara Grant - INVITATION ONL Bona Vista Lounge".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This says "invitation only".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you're invited. You're a  big donor to the campaign. They love  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR SMITH digs  into the manila envelope, comes out with a handful of security badges, name tags, invites. He plucks the name tag that MS JONES printed earlier. It has a red  ribbon signifying a Major Donor to the Campaign. He faste it to Gene's lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'11 get you in anywhere.  Red  Elevator. Thirty-fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get these? Who are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the guy who's going to kill your  daughter if you don't get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE approaches. He notices a flurry of movement, a small GROUP OF PEOPLE moving determinedly through the lobby. It GOVERNOR ELEANOR GRANT with a small entourage!  She is a  handsome woman in her fifties. The entourage consists of  KRISTA BROOKS, Eleanor's, late-twenties assistant, a few  assorted POLITICAL AIDES and a couple of PEOPLE WITH NAME TAGS. GENE is not sure what to do. The group reaches the  elevator. KRISTA pushes the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They-didn't hear a word I said. The  mike was too low on the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did we pay for that room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA turns to an Aide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Have Nolin pre-check the PA systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. They crowd in. The doors start t close. Gene looks around, where did Mr. Smith go? GENE springs forward, thrusts his hand between them. The  doors stop, then bounce open. GENE is startled, finding  himself face to face with a cold eyed bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, this car is for the  Governor. You can take the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare, Franco. This is one  of our biggest supporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles charmingly, offers her hand to GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor Grant, gubernatorial  incumbent. That's a mouthful isn't-  it? I love saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE steps aboard, shakes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose idea was it to have a lunch  right after the brunch? I'm about to  bust as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just walk through, do a little  grip-and-grin, then get ready for  the press con.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on the third floor. The doors have closed and the elevator begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes out a little louder then he intended. He has tur his back to the door. Everyone looks at him. He's committ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you Mr....Watson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its'...ah...about my daughter....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator slows and stops on the next floor above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on the fourth floor. Behind GENE, the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room for one more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can accommodate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers her hand to MR. SMITH as he steps on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor Grant, gubernatorial  incumbent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure to meet you, Governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car begins to rise again. ELEANOR .GRANT turns back t GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying?  Your daughter....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MR SMITH
dialogues.text: Yes???

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: What to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ..ahh...wanted me to... be sure  to get your autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  I wish everything were  that easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the pen if you've got the  paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at her. She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at what she refers to: the manila envelope he ho the one MR. SMITH gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that something precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's,..that's fine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives it to ELEANOR GRANT. KRISTA hands over the pen.  GENE's eyes flick over to MR. SMITH who is staring at the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at the Governor, only inches away, back to MR. SMITH, who raises his eyes, nods, his silent message curt do it! GENE pulls his eyes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name? Her name is Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT writes the autograph. MR. SMITH'S eyes dril into him. GENE looks over. MR. SMITH raises a hand to his face, pretends to scratch an itch. His other hand taps hi wristwatch. GENE's hand slides toward his jacket pocket. Sweat beads on his forehead. He's barely aware of KRISTA  talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny. I don't even keep a pad  of paper with me anymore, everything's  gone so electronic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a quick, weak smile. His free hand wipes the sweat from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for double A batteries  I'd be in big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is slowly reaching into the pocket with the gun, but s when he notices MR. SMITH'S hand slide into his jacket, w his gun is. He looks at the other MR. SMITH, earphone, crewcut-Securi There is the hint of a gun on his hip. GENE's eyes widen, dart to MR. SMITH'S face, his hand sli into his coat. His hand hovers over his gun, trembling. I the SECURITY MAN staring at him? ELEANOR GRANT hands over the autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Elevators make me  queasy, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE gives her a sick smile, abruptly turns away. He take his hand out of his pocket. It's shaking. He clenches it stop the shakes. The doors open, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT and her entourage exit to greetings and  applause. GENE stays in the elevator, frozen, alone with MR. SMITH. The doors close and the elevator descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH is fuming, his face red. He explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was right in front of you! What's  wrong with you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fists clench. He seems about to lose control. He back GENE into a corner, physically terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you 'fucking with me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't loaded. I didn't put the  bullets in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises a fist. Struggles with the impulse to smash GEN controls it. Angrily, he takes the gun from GENE's pocket expertly loads it with bullets from his own pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get many chances like that,  Mr. Watson. That's the way life works.  Don't blow the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the glass,wall of the elevator with his eyes GENE looks out and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van. It's moving into a parking spot across from the  Bonaventure, on Flower Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN is coloring a picture in her stolen book. MS. JONES  takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done much better ones than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. I'll show you. I have much  more colors at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. (checks her watch) That's good, sweetie pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator continues its descent and the van disappears from view. GENE strains to see it again, but it's impossi MR. SMITH jams the loaded gun into GENE's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, all loaded. Ready for the  hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator, doors open into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH walks out. GENE follows. MR. SMITH, suddenly be self-conscious, walks away from GENE. The object of his  shyness: A JAPANESE TOURIST COUPLE nearby. The man is tap his wife with a video camera.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW THROUGH VIDEO CAMERA
dialogues.text: We see what the camera is seeing, the WIFE, smiling. Behi her, we see GENE, looking confusedly after Mr. Smith.  He turns, walks out of frame. In the corner of the picture, read-out of the TIME: 12:31:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in real life, GENE walks toward a shoeshine stand ou the Men's Room. "Huey's Polished Act" and below that, han lettered, "Disabled Veteran" where HUEY himself, a fiftyi black man, reads a "Smithsonian" magazine. He sees GENE and perks up - a customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a rough day? Down at the heels  as they...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But GENE goes right past HUEY and into the Men's Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) You don't see your face, you don't  pay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY gives up, goes back to his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene goes- over to one of the sinks, runs the cold water, splashes his face, looks in the mirror, into his own eyes He tries to find an answer, a way out. A pay phone, on th wall behind him, comes into focus. Then a hand reaches in grabs the receiver...and yanks it, snapping the wire.  Ge spins around.  It is MR. SMITH, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH smiles. GENE doesn't. MR. SMITH leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE exits the Men's Room and walks back the route he cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY sets down his magazine again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a rough day? Down at the heels  as they say? What you need is a shoe  shine, shoe shine, shoe shine today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's HUEY's usual patter, he's said it a thousand times.  GENE looks around. MR. SMITH is in the lounge area, facing the Flower Street entrance, able to keep the Men's Room and GENE in view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take ten, take a break, take a seat,  take a load off. Put the world in  perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE lets HUEY usher him into a chair. The gun in his jacket pocket clunks against the arm of th chair. A grim reminder. He pulls out the itinerary.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: 12:45  -  Governor Eleanor Samara Grant  -  Pacific Rim  Multi-Cultural Conference  -  Pool Deck  -  Fourth Floor GENE looks at his watch.
The minute hand clicks to 12:33 as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: He works away at GENE's shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you a visitor or lucky enough  to live in The City of Angels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more of HUEY's patter, no real substance to the inqu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...I'm visiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE watches MR. SMITH frown and amble toward the shoeshi stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do, if I may be so bold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at MR. SMITH) I'm just an accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't denigrate yourself, my friend.  Where would the government be without  accountants?  They wouldn't know how  hard they can squeeze us before we  pop, isn't that right?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SMITH
dialogues.text: He takes note of the conversation and wanders back to his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you take tips. Time was a tip  was between a man and his customer.  Not any more. They've figured out  what they call a formulae, don't  laugh, it ain't for babies. They  take your sales, see, and slap a  percentile on there, figuring that  somewhere between your lies and your  bad luck they'll hit on the mean  amount, mean meaning "in the middle",  but if you ask me it means "just  plain mean". Why you can have Uncle  Scrooge wring a nickel over your  poor out-stretched palm, or Daddy  Warbucks dropping pearl stick-pins  like manna from heaven, don't make  no difference, they'll tax your behind  according to that same figure. Doesn't  seem quite right., does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellboy GUSTINO walks by, calls out to HUEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Huey, how's it hangin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a load, my friend, but somebody's  got to carry it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUSTINO laughs, waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? You have to speak up. (taps his ear) I'm a little deaf in this ear. Between  that and my wooden leg I'm a mess.  Compliments of the United States  Army Artillery Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have you out of here in two  shakes o'f a lamb's tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is within himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE I keep wondering what she would do if she was here.  She'd figure it out. She'd run it down like a column of  numbers. Pro's and cons. That's the way she was: Lists al over the house. HUEY's manic shoe-shining slows down: who has he got in h chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drove me crazy. There must have been  one on me. I didn't add up so she  left. That's what attracted me to  her In the first place. She made up  her mind and she did it. She wouldn't  sit around waiting for...whatever.  She'd do something. She'd do  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY keeps his eyes on his work. He's afraid he's got a l one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, you know, for a quality  shoe you can't beat a good wingtip.  Wears like iron. You're a wise man.  There ya' go. Two bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY gestures for GENE to get down. GENE steps to the flo He pays HUEY with a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything smaller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE is thinking about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...thanks muchly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks around the lobby, at MR. SMITH, the Flower Str entrance, the rest of the area, feeling the gun in his po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get out to Flower Street from  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Go down past the bar. Take you  right out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY nods toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE walks toward the bar. HUEY shakes his head: time for the boys in white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks towards the Flower Street entrance. The van is still there. A bus pulls up. GENE walks past MR. SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get another chance in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have time for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mr. Watson, but make it  just one. I don't want you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But GENE is long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE walks into the area of the bar. The BARTENDER is jus returning to chat with a customer, a REPORTER who is gett sloshed. GENE moves slowly along the bar, into an area wh MR. SMITH'S view of him is blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Something about the  Governor's new regime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE hears this and glances towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. She's dumping the Good Old  Boys like yesterday's newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE sees that MR.SMITH can no longer see him. He scans t lobby, sees a smaller door that leads onto Flower Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white boys are in for it. When  they got her elected they never  thought she was gonna make the  Governor's office look like the United  Nations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER laughs. GENE quickly cuts across the lobby out the smaller door onto Flower Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking Custer's Last Stand  here. The only minorities not on her  staff are the ones still lost in the  Rain Forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE comes out the door, dashes across the street, weavin through the traffic. Once across, he heads up the sidewalk toward the van, kee low, sneaking up behind it. He crouches by the front door one hand sliding into his pocket for the' gun, the other the door handle. He raises his head cautiously and looks  inside the cab. No MS. JONES up front at least. He takes a breath, braces himself. With one motion he jerks the back door open, yan out the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing he sees, fixates on, is LYNN. She is stre out on the seat, eyes closed, mouth open. She appears dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a gasp) Lynn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. You'll wake the baby up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES is sitting on the seat behind the one LYNN is o GENE points the gun at her face. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) What we have here is what they call  a Mexican standoff. The thing you  gotta ask yourself is, "What's behind  the seat?"  Now, a twenty-two'd go  right through it, but even a button  will throw a twenty-two off so there's  a good chance it'd get screwed up  somewhere along the way, miss the  target. Maybe a thirty-eight?  A  thirty-eight'11 drill pretty straight, unless it hits metal, then it'll  bust up in little bitty pieces.  They'll keep going but they'll be  slowed down quite a bit. How's about  a three-fifty-seven?  It'll go through  the seat, her, you, the dashboard,  shit, it'll go through the engine  block before it knows it's hit  anything, end up in some pedestrian  three blocks away. What do you think?  What's my poison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE look at Lynn's sleeping face - the gun in his own ha He lowers the gun, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's a comfort to know you've  got the co-Jones to pull that thing  out. Whether you've got the balls to  pull the trigger we've still got to  see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE climbs out of the van, shuts the door, leans there. gall of his defeat is hard to swallow. He realizes he's  holding the gun, hurriedly tucks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES puts her gun down, raises a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the walkie-talkie) He's coming back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I've got him in the crosshairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH near the entrance, eating some food. He watches GENE walk past him. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at his watch, then checks the itinerary once m

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: 12:45 -  Governor Eleanor Samara Grant - Pacific Kim Mult Cultural Conference - Pool Deck - Fourth Floor

dialogues.speaker: GENE-NEAR BUFFET AREA
dialogues.text: GENE addresses another Bellboy, HECTOR who is moving lugg out to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pool Deck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth Floor. Take that escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE thanks him and moves across the lobby MR. SMITH foll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE heads toward the escalators. Ahead of him, he sees  ELEANOR GRANT and BRENDAN GRANT surrounded by AIDES and  SECURITY MEN facing a crowd of PRESS PEOPLE. The Governor and her husband have an arm around each other. They are  smiling, relaxed, quite the" happy couple. They give each other a warm kiss. Camera flashes, recording the moment. GENE, heading toward them, has to thread his way through large WEDDING PARTY - tuxedos and bridesmaid gowns. When clears them he has neared the impromptu press conference.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN GRANT
dialogues.text: He is now alone in front of a campaign poster, fielding  questions from a few remaining REPORTERS. Farther on, ELEANOR GRANT and her entourage can be seen t the escalator up. GENE heads that way, passing BRENDAN GR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife is not interested in negative  campaigning. She wants to accentuate  the positive. I don't know about you  but I find that refreshing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought of running for  office yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, charmingly) Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRETTY YOUNG WOMAN walks by. The Governor's husband's e follow her appreciatively as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a business man.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: He nears the escalator. It's crowded and GENE is pulled i the midst of NEWS PEOPLE, TV, RADIO, PRESS. He joins the  flow and lets it pull him along. GENE rides the escalator to the Second Floor and follows crowd up two flights of the circular stairs. Down a short tunnel and out onto the Pool Deck.

About an acre of grass on the Fourth Floor. Skyways conne the Pool Deck to the office buildings across Flower and  Figueroa. A platform has been set up with chairs and  microphones in front of a podium.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: GENE blinks in the sudden, bright sunshine. When his eyes adjust, he finds himself in a line that is approaching A  SECURITY MAN with a hand-held metal detector. He panics,  turns, trying to escape, but finds himself bumped along,  trapped. The line shuffles forward. He turns, determined make a supreme effort to escape and finds himself facing 2ND SECURITY MAN, who waves him to one side. 2ND SECURITY MAN Excuse me, sir, You don't have to wait. can take you over here. GENE is dragged forward. He looks around; no way out. He  stands, expectant, as the detector slides down one side o his body, is lifted over to the other. Down it slides, to the pocket concealing the gun. GENE waits for the alarm - which doesn't come. The SECURITY MAN operating the gizmo  deftly switches it off as it passes the weapon. GENE is p on, looking back, confused, alarmed, finds himself among: PRESS by the dozens. Eleanor Samara Grant SUPPORTERS by t hundreds. SECURITY MEN and COPS IN UNIFORM. GENE moves th them, trying to figure out what just happened. He glances back to the 2ND SECURITY MAN, and bumps into one particul POLICE OFFICER, plain clothes, badge in pocket, who react with a quick laugh. POLICE OFFICER Easy, sir. Got to watch where you're going a crowd like this. He is a handsome, solid-looking guy. You'd trust him. Cal him OFFICER TRUST. OFFICER TRUST seems to be in charge. H moves off through the crowd, giving LOCAL POLICE orders i an easy way. GENE looks around. He can't see MR. SMITH. He edges his w after OFFICER TRUST, who reaches the wall beyond which is the drop to the street. He leans there comfortably, scann the crowd, GENE reaches the wall a few yards away from hi He looks out at the city, getting his courage up. Just as turns to approach OFFICER TRUST:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE freezes! MR. SMITH appears from the crowd, joins him He smugly flips his walkie-talkie into the air, catches i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do in my place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips the walkie-talkie, catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bitch would be dead. Course I  ain't sayin' which bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips the walkie-talkie. GENE lashes out, smacks the w talkie. It sails over the edge, falls and smashes onto th sidewalk four stories below. MR. SMITH goes ballistic. GENE walks away from him - right up to OFFICER TRUST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a plot to kill the Governor.  If you don't believe me, check that  guy right there. He has a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER TRUST looks at MR. SMITH and then at GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you, Mr. Watson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And OFFICER TRUST reaches in his hip pocket for a spare W Talkie that he tosses to MR. SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got this under control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't look like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It better be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER TRUST walks away. MR. SMITH stares at a devastated GENE. He sticks the walk talkie into his pocket, grabs GENE under the arm, drags h to an isolated corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I oughta throw you after that walkie- talkie but I'm going to give you a  break because you're an amateur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER offers a tray of hors d'houvres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. Have a cracker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a cracker, Mr. Watson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE woodenly takes one. The WAITER moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this guy. Big guy. Irish- Italian. Red-faced, black-haired,  jolly son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see them from a distance - just a couple guys chatting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody could make me laugh like him.  We closed more bars together than I  can count. He was my pal. I loved  that crazy mick, I'm not ashamed to  say it. But he was fuck-up. He had  this image of himself. Thought he  was con man. Always trying to shave  the edge. Nickel and dime. I'll always  miss him. Tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me why I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He's dead. Tell me  why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me why he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE stares at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, I killed him. He fucked  up one too many times so I put a  bullet in his eye. Then I put two  more into him just to make sure. Now  that was somebody I loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves in on GENE, crowding him. He breathes hard, look like one insane piece of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved that motherfucker but I got  the call and I put him down like a  sick animal. So if you've got any  doubts about what's going to happen  if you don't deliver let me tell you  something. I'd make gravy out of  your little girl just to season that  black Irish cocksucker's meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of applause catches their attention.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
dialogues.text: She and her entourage enter the Pool Deck and walk toward the platform. ELEANOR GRANT gladhands people on the way.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SMITH
dialogues.text: He turns' back to GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you're supposed to do. Do it  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs GENE and gives him a push. There is a general  movement in the crowd toward the platform. GENE is buffet along. MR. SMITH follows him, keeping him in sight, but t a PACK OF PHOTOGRAPHERS move in, start snapping, lifting  their cameras high to shoot over the crowd. MR. SMITH  instinctively turns away, hiding his face. He moves aroun the PHOTOGS and finds himself separated from GENE by the  mob. He searches, trying to spot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: In the crowd, GENE is bumped this way and that. His face  displays an inner devastation. His eyes focus desperately something ahead: It is the back of ELEANOR GRANT'S head. She is turning th way and that, greeting supporters. GENE's hand slides into his pocket, grips the gun. He is the end of his rope. He is going to do it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSTRUM
dialogues.text: A local POLITICO mounts the platform, taps the microphone LOCAL POLITICO Can I have your attention Please! Please  welcome a man who was for 19 years the distinguished Mayo of Los Angeles.  The honorable Tom Bradley. The CROWD reacts loudly, yells and whistles. GENE-pushes way forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my extreme pleasure this  afternoon to introduce to you...

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: He is now a few yards from ELEANOR GRANT. He comes up aga the SECURITY MAN who gave him the once-over with the meta detector. The man's eyes slide over him, then he looks aw He nonchalantly steps aside, moves off through the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a woman who can only be  characterized as a one-of-a-kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE is close to ELEANOR GRANT. She is just a few bodies  away, visible between them. His hand moves in his pocket. swallows. The impulse sweeps over him and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA BROOKS, the young woman from the elevator is next him, smiling. He looks at her in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An iconoclast with class...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator. You weren't feeling  well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at ELEANOR GRANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A genuine lady who's not afraid to  get into the trenches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE turns, scans the crowd - no sign of MR. SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and go to the mat with greedy  special interests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at KRISTA, studies her intensely. She's a bit  unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The finest Governor our state has  ever had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again GENE looks at ELEANOR GRANT. She's turning around,  facing the crowd, facing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend and yours, Governor Eleanor  Grant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT raises her arms. A perfect target. The CROW roars as GENE turns back to KRISTA. He leans into her, sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife always said I had a problem  trusting people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can trust Eleanor Samara  Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. I'm going to  trust you. And you have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista looks at Gene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you're right, I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...my daughter ... she's going  to die...unless you can help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista assesses Gene, his desperate tone of voice. Obviou a nut case. A well-dressed nut case, but a nut case  nevertheless. Krista, nervous, looks around for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure, I'll help you. Let me  get Mr. White. I'm sure he can assist  you, he's our...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene pulls the gun, holding it in Krista's sight only,  unnoticed by anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) No! You have to listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista stares wide-eyed at the gun, at Gene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening, I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROSTRUM
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT takes over the microphone from the beaming  LOCAL POLITICO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends, my good friends...

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Gene and Krista are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden by potted plants and campaign posters at the fring of the CROWD, GENE confronts KRISTA, covering her with th pocketed gun. In the background, ELEANOR GRANT delivers a ringing speech, accented with applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...please...you have to believe  me... They have my daughter.  They  want me to kill Eleanor Grant  or  they'll kill my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA tries to edge away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's just...let's get  security in on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You can't! They're in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how they could be in on  it. They're the best. They're hand- picked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. One of them is following  me. If he knew what I'd just told  you they'd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE pulls the gun from his pocket. She recoils, thinking he's going to shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, how did I get in here with  this!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA stares at the gun. She can't deny the fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to trust me. I'm putting  my daughter's life in your hands.  She's only six. She's just a little  girl. Please, please, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little hard to trust you under  the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at her intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, it is. (beat) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE offers KRISTA the gun. She is surprised, to say the  least. She takes it gingerly, with only the tips of her  fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you trust me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the gun, at the strange man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll have to. Come on, there's  one person we can go to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man following me has a walkie- talkie. If he sees I'm not here he'll  call his partner. I do anything out  of line and he'll send the word to  kill my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll think you're in the crowd until  the end of the speech. Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps closer to the platform/ listens. ELEANOR GRANT' voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I remember that horrible night as  if it were yesterday. A phone call  pulling me out of sleep, the terrible  news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA checks her watch. 12:48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband and child senselessly  killed by a drunk driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got about ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this speech a lot. Come  on. We'll take care of him.  We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. You asked me for help. Let  me help. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to lead him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops her, points to the gun she still holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better put that away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a handkerchief, covers the gun and tucks it out of sight as she leads him behind the platform and awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH still roams the crowd, looking for Gene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But tragedy, if it doesn't destroy  us, has a curious way of giving us  strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees OFFICER TRUST who gives him a questioning look. H ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt if I would be before you  now, if I hadn't been put through  that crucible of loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR SMITH notices the JAPANESE TOURIST COUPLE we met befor The man has the video camera pointed at a sharp up angle. MR. SMITH glances up toward what the man is shooting.  Consternation and anger fill his face.

dialogues.speaker: RED BONAVENTURE TOWER
dialogues.text: What he sees is one of the exterior elevators rising. KRI stands at the glass looking down. Behind her, just glimps is GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And though I can never forget William  and Bill Junior or the love I felt  for them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH cuts a wake through the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have found joy again in serving  this great state. I have found love  again in my second husband Brendan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. GENE and KRISTA bolt out and hur down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA leads GENE past the SECURITY GUARD stationed in th hallway at a small table. GENE tries to keep his face tur away. The GUARD glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Brooks ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk past him. He's a bit curious about GENE, but sh it off. GENE and KRISTA reach a door and knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? Are you sure we can  trust him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure. It's her husband. He's her  Campaign Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. BRENDAN GRANT is framed there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to see you, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs GENE and pushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upscale suite. BRENDAN GRANT'S coat is draped on a chair. KRISTA moves past him, pulling GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to KRISTA) We have to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Brendan, listen to me. Someone  is trying to kill Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need people we can "trust. We  only have a few moments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is...this is insane. How do you  know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it because I'm the one who's  supposed to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are!? (to KRISTA) You brought this man here!? You  brought this man to my room!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to. Her Security people may be  involved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the sound of a toilet flushing in an adjacent  bathroom. The door opens and A MAN emerges drying his han on a hotel towel. He is late-middle-aged, white, mild-loo perhaps wearing glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem, Brendan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There certainly is. This man says  he's been hired to kill Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not hired. They're blackmailing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this "they"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...I don't know. Please, Mr.  Grant! They have my daughter. I'm  not some lunatic. Your wife is in  trouble.  Someone is trying to kill  her. Someone is trying to make me  kill her. Please, listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on the strength of this story,  you bring this man to Brendan's suite?   Does that show good judgment, Ms.  Brooks?  I'm just a friend of  Brendan's, but it seems to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
