dialogues.text: He brought a gun onto the pool deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got onto the pool deck with a  gun. How did he get past her Security  carrying a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Where is this gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, is it real? Do we know anything  about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks real. I don't know anything  about guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTA gets out the gun, wrapped in the handkerchief, han it to him. It lays in the palm of his hand. He unwraps it awkwardly, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness. It certainly looks real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks beyond them, towards the entrance to the suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your opinion? You're the expert  in these matters, supposedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE turns, to see who he is talking to.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH stands by the open door. Before GENE can speak, MR. SMITH moves. It is fluid and cohtroled and fast. He  marches across the room, detouring to grab a pillow from couch. He takes the gun, shoves" it- into the pillow and  goes face to face with KRISTA. She just has time to wonde what is going on There is a double muffled gunshot. Shock fills her eyes, she slides to the floor. GENE can only st there, unbelieving, freaked to the gills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, staring at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd say it's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking mind!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. OFFICER TRUST slides in quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody mind telling me... (sees KRISTA's body)) What the hell happened!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get her off the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER TRUST checks the hall, shuts the door. They begin drag her body to the bathroom. The MYSTERY MAN watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done to me!? Christ  almighty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE's eyes follow them. As if rousing from a sleep he co to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to rush to the bathroom but MR. SMITH is right t gripping him. GENE struggles frantically, uselessly, watc the bathroom door close. MR. SMITH is beyond anger. He gr GENE'S throat, muscles down. GENE grips the iron hand tha cutting off his air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MYSTERY MAN grabs MR. SMITH'S arm, tries to pry him l MR. SMITH is beyond reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to kill your kid!? You  want me to kill you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE's eyes begin to roll back in his head. Everything be fading to black. The blackness retreats in a rush and GENE finds himself  staring at the butt of MR. SMITH'S gun, visible under his coat. He reaches for it, yanks it out, fires point-blank  into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH, again, again. MR. SMITH'S shocked face falls a GENE heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER TRUST steps between GENE and the door. GENE shoot him down and is out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE stumbles out in the hall, gun in hand. He hurries do the hall, looking back to see the MYSTERY MAN and a wound OFFICER TRUST spill out of Room 2503. The HALL OFFICER pu his weapon MYSTERY MAN Get him! GENE fires at the HALL OFFICER who goes down. GENE rushes down the hall. One of the guest room door's opens and a M staggers out. It is a bloody, wounded MR. SMITH! GENE sto in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And MR. SMITH grabs him by the collar and throws him over railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE is falling, falling. He passes the ascending elevato and gets a glimpse of MS. JONES and LYNN, pressed against the glass, her face a mask of terror. The floor rushes up meet GENE and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he hits the floor, thrown there by MR. SMITH. His esca has been a dream. A wrist-watch fills the frame. 12:56. It is GENE's. We are seeing his P.O.V. He's laying on the floor, his watch-hand in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nearly killed him, too, you idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly doesn't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose the P.O.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on record. I never wanted this.  I wanted simplicity; a telescopic  sight, a powerful rifle, but no.  What was good enough for Oswald wasn't  good enough for you two. You had to  get fancy. Drag some shmuck in off  the street, stick a gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's academic now. She had to be  killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you going to do, Brendan?  Lock her in a closet?  You're in the  fucking kitchen now. Get used to the  heat. He's been seen all over the  hotel, looking like some Loony Tunes.  We even got him on video. It'll work.  Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE stirs on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about GENE) Is he awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks GENE to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Great. Why don't we just give him  our home phone numbers while we're  at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what he hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls GENE over to the bathroom door. Throws it open.  GENE reacts to what he sees within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it looks like. She was  alive a minute ago. Now she's dead.  Because you wouldn't do what I told  you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get going. You've only got a few  minutes to pull it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH takes GENE out of the suite into the hall.  The door closes. Brendan, the Mystery Man and Officer Trust a alone BRENDAN GRANT I don't know if we should go through  with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a dead woman on my bathroom  floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it? She's Eleanor's  assistant and they will have been  shot with the same gun, by the same  lunatic.  Some, anonymous loser who  went over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing easier) Only thing better would be if he  were a postal worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't be doing any work once I  get through with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in a few months you're in the  Governor's mansion. The people'd  make you king of California if they  could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN GRANT laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER TRUST exits from the room and engages the HALL OF in conversation down the hall. GENE and MR. SMITH turns t other way, walk. In an undertone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid.. I know how this is  supposed, to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you now, Mr. Watson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kill her - and you kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if you don't, Her Security men  will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the elevator. MR. SMITH punches the button. GE turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to get away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my problem, Mr. Watson

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out the walkie-talkie, keys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the walkie-talkie) Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know you won't kill my  daughter once I'm gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the walkie-talkie) Come Back....Fucking Radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH is getting nothing but static. He angrily keys  off, hisses at GENE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you she'd be alright, if you  do your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm supposed to trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. MR. SMITH gestures graciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step into the elevator. Stare at each other. The doo close. MR. SMITH erupts. He grabs GENE slams him into the outside window. GENE's face is smashed into the glass by SMITH'S shoulder. His body presses GENE against the glass wall and he speaks, his mouth an inch from GENE's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out there! You see the van?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van can be seen below on Flower Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! He slams GENE's head against the window. He lifts u the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jabs the walkie-talkie next to GENE's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Daddy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a scream. The horrible sound of a little girl in terrible pain. It cuts through GENE like a stab in the he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles to turn around. MR. SMITH kidney punches him hard! GENE goes down on one knee. The car stops. SOMEONE starts to board it, stops in surpr MR. SMITH sticks a badge in their face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security. Take the next car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They back off. The doors close, the car continues its des MR. SMITH lifts the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a gasp) No, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bone-chilling scream from the walkie-talkie. GENE ripped to his soul. MR. SMITH hauls him to his feet, shov him against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one last chance. Half an  hour and that kid is dead. I'll kill  her myself. I'll rip her fucking  head off right in front of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH releases GENE, who goes limp. The elevator door open onto the lobby. MR. SMITH gets out, straightening his tie, wiping the swe from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE gets out of the elevator, almost getting caught in t closing doors. He can't even fight back at the doors. The pound him a couple of times before he is able to step cle of the elevator. GENE stifles a retch, hurries away. MR. SMITH is standing there. Childish giggles erupt from walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered, giggling) Daddy, did you hear me scream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES holds the walkie-talkie for LYNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me to scream as loud as I  could. Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE staggers over to the row of sinks. Leaning on one si with both hands, his body shudders violently. And he thro up. A man exits a toilet stall and walks toward the sinks. He sees GENE retching, turns away in disgust, and leaves qui GENE turns on the faucets.to wash the mess away. He tries to clean up, but catches his reflection in the  mirror. He has trouble looking himself in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH is fuming. Into the walkie-talkie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next time I tell you to do  something, you goddamn well do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES tries to be private on the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck you! You want to baby-sit  a screaming kid in traffic, come out  here and do it yourself. He got the  message, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN watches her, knowing something's not quite right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE comes out of the Men's Room, stands there at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a rough day? Down at the heels  as they say? What you need is a shoe  shine, shoe shine, shoe shine today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks around. HUEY has his nose in his magazine, cal out his patter for whoever drifts by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE walks over, climbs into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still not looking up) Take ten, take a break, take a seat,  take a load off. Put the world in  perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE has settled into the chair. HUEY tosses the magazine aside, swings into action...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you a visitor or are you  lucky enough to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and freezes, staring at the familiar pair of shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he looks up) You got a complaint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember. The big tipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is going to happen. When  it's over you'll know what I was  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Something is going to  happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The end of the world? Man,  don't give me your mad rap. I'm not  a bartender. I don't want to hear  it. I raise a family doing this  bullshit. Do me a favor. Get your  crazy white ass out of my chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, a big tip doesn't give you the  right to crap in my ear. You want  change?  You got it, brother. What  was that you gave me, a twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY kneels down, gets his cashbox, starts to open it up. From behind him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's get some privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It spills out of GENE almost without volition. There's a  note of pleading hidden in it. GENE slowly points a thumb HUEY's "Disabled Veteran" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear a word we're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH looks at the sign. HUEY stops what he's doing - "What the fuck?" He almost says it aloud, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be kidding me now, would  you, Mr. Watson? (to HUEY's back) Hey, nigger! Is that right? You can't  hear me? Nigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY's face settles into something cold. What's he going do?  He stands, looks at GENE, who stares back at him, th slowly turns around, looks at MR. SMITH - and breaks into jive-ass grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, looky-here. My customer-quotient  just got multiplied by two. What do  you think of that?  You'll have to  forgive me, sir. Didn't hear your  approach. Fact of the matter is, I'm  deef as a post. Compliments of the  United States Army... (does a snappy salute) ...Artillery Corps. Can I give you a  shine, sir? You don't see your face,  you don't pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH is suspicious but he climbs into the second cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Yeah, sure, give me a shine... (looks at GENE) ...shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY goes to work on his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting your toy back in your  pocket, Mr. Watson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen by MR. SMITH, HUEY takes a peek and sees the gun b transferred to GENE's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all wound up. Now let's get out  your itinerary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE does. "1:'30 - California Leads the Nation into the 21st Centur California Ballroom - Governor Eleanor Samara Grant and  Brendan Grant" It is the last entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thirty. California Ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at HUEY) That's right. That gives you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his watch. 1:04.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...twenty-six minutes to get your  shit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want'to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talk to her or you can forget about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you threaten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about it,  shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances again at HUEY) You know  what I'm gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Walk out there and twist her  arm off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a lot less trouble just  to let me talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other for a few beats. Then MR. SMITH  checks HUEY out and gets out the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into it) Come Back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE grabs the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sweetie, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I'm tired. I want to.go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. JONES holds the walkie-talkie for LYNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Not just yet, baby. There's...there's  something Daddy has to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be a hero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH, GENE and HUEY in situ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey, not to be a hero. But I  want you to remember something for  me, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing it for you. No matter  what anybody tells you, no matter  who they are, he's doing it for you,  because he loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the walkie-talkie, but GENE stares him dow Back to the walkie-talkie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you promise me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Kisses to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) No...kisses to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Kisses to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) No, kisses to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH grabs the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who the fuck you do it  for just so you do it. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down, snaps his fingers in HUEY's face. HUEY l up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives the shoes a final wipe, stands away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dollars, if it pleases you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't. I remember when it was a  fuckin' quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a couple dollars to HUEY. To GENE as he stalks  away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY turns back to GENE. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, what are you dragging me  into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dragging you into anything.  I don't expect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gorilla's watching you, is that  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't let him be seeing you  talking to me. I don't want him  twisting my arm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE lowers his head, covers his mouth with a hand. HUEY  pretends to work on his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was your kid on the walkie- talkie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter. They have her in a van  across the street. They say they'll  kill her if I don't do something for  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In twenty-five minutes in the  California Ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a woman. She was trying to  help me. I watched him murder her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the Governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY checks his perimeters, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I should have packed up and  gone home as soon as I got that  twenty. What am I supposed to do  about this situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them is in on it. He might  even be in charge. Her Security is  in on it. There's only one person I  know for sure isn't in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Governor. If I could just talk  to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, there's nothing you can do  to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you drag me into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting emotional) It's my kid. I've got to...to  somehow...do right by my little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out her picture, stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time I did. I was one of  those guys, workaholics. I worked my  ass off for them - my wife, my  daughter.  That's just what I thought  I was supposed to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all right, listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running on) So when she wanted a divorce...I  was...I didn't know what I'd done  wrong. I didn't see it. I didn't see  it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY takes his wooden brush and whacks GENE on the foot,  snapping him from his downward spiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me about the early  years some other time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You understand I don't  mind dying if I could save my  daughter. I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, now listen.  I can't mess with  these shoes any more or it's gonna  look funny. You go down get yourself  something to drink. Make sure Godzilla  there, follows you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't the faintest idea. Go on  now. I'll get word to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE gets down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If nothing else, someone heard my  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives HUEY a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE just stands there. HUEY has to give him a little pus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE turns and walks across the lobby toward the bar. His mind is racing. As he passes MR. SMITH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH rises immediately, looks back at HUEY. HUEY giv him a symbolic tip of the hat. MR. SMITH follows GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE finds a stool at the empty part of the bar. The plac is half-full, noisy. The television is showing a game sho The BARTENDER comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) ...and time is running out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a ...a gingerale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH sits -at the other end of the bar. The BARTENDE gets him a beer. GENE and MR. SMITH lock eyes in the mirr Between them, a couple of T.V. NEWS TECHNICIANS are grabb a quick beer. A video camera resides on the bar by them. GENE notices OFFICER TRUST, walking by on a level above,  watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I thought she was going to get  out the violins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. If I hear that stop the  violence routine one more time I'm  going to shoot somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS appears suddenly at GENE's elbow, surprising h She puts a basket of pretzels next to him and a coaster n to his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your Ginger Ale, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.V. NEWS TECHNICIAN 1 Politicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS is tapping a long fingernail against the bar GENE looks down and sees it. A note on the coaster. "Men' Room - Huey." The WAITRESS turns the coaster over, and leaves. GENE loo down the bar at MR. SMITH, drinking, unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what bothers me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at his watch. 1:12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they get all weepy eyed about  the "ordinary citizen", the "regular  Joe", the "normal American". Gimme a  break. There ain't no such animal.  We're a nation of two hundred forty  million special interest groups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm just a regular guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The T.V. NEWS TECHNICIANS stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. But I've built a  good solid business out of nothing.  Don't underestimate the regular guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the open lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you haven't paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the Special Interest at the  end of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE jerks a thumb at MR. SMITH and is gone. MR. SMITH st to follow him. The BARTENDER is right with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sir, don't make me call a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH slaps some money on the bar and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left field bleachers heard from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH scans the lobby trying to spot Gene. OFFICER TR comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Did you lose him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere, GENE circles around the lobby. There seem to b clocks everywhere. A. set of four clocks over the registration desk with the time for Tokyo, Los Angeles, New York, and Paris. The souvenir shop has a dozen clocks on display, with the logos of various LA sports teams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant, the travel agency, the newsstand, all hav clocks. 1:14 . Everywhere he turns. GENE has to look at his watch. 1:15! GENE's watch and all the clocks tick over at once.  GENE winces as if he could hear all those minute hands ti over one number in a thunderous chorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's near the Men's Room. HUEY's stand has a sign on the  chair - "Gone to Lunch" and there is a clock face with  moveable hands. "We'll be back at 1:30."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voice) Let's all hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he enters the Men's Room. Across the lobby MR. SMITH spots him, heads that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE enters to find HUEY and GUSTINO the Bellboy. HUEY ru to the door, keeping a lookout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, off with the shoes and pants.  Trade with Gustino. The big guy's  coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH marching towards the Men's Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY turns to see GENE and GUSTINO just looking at each o uncomfortable, to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, ladies. No time to be shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE kicks off his shoes, shucks his pants. He trades his pants and jacket with GUSTINO, who has done the same.  GUSTINO's pants are too big for GENE. His pants are too s for GUSTINO. GUSTINO goes into a stall and closes the door. HUEY comes back from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gustino! Drop 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUSTINO has taken a seat inside the stall, but with GENE' pants still up. He drops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And cover up them socks. Man, who  dresses you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY leads GENE to another door. "Service Personnel Only" He taps on it. It is opened by a Latino JANITOR. HUEY and GENE slip through the door, shut it. The JANITOR begins  mopping the floor as MR. SMITH comes in. His eyes come to rest on the stall. All he sees are GENE' shoes and GENE's pants crumpled around the ankles. MR. SMITH smirks and leaves. The Janitor raps on GUSTINO's stall with the mop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fue.  (Gone.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY and GENE move down a drab service corridor. Boxes st on both sides, floor buffers at rest, shelves with cleani supplies. GENE notices for the first time that HUEY has a pronounced limp. They come upon IRENE the Cleaning Woman. She joins them m down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene is going to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRENE takes GENE's hand and leads him along at a half-tro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come through a short corridor and onto the service  elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said there was only one person  you knew wasn't in on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to go see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRENE punches the button for the twenty-fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure she's asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took up extra pillows. She take a  nap before her big speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to say to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come to you. See if you can  stop this thing 'fore it gets started.  Save us all considerable  embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY takes a pillow and a blanket from IRENE'S cart and p it into GENE's arms IRENE You don't have to save me. I go nothin' to do with it. You ain't gettin' no key from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Irene...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service elevator stops. IRENE pushes her cart out int the hall signalling them to stay put for a second. She st moving out into the hall, the card key falls on the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the other end of the hall the HALL OFFICER turns when hears her approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE and HUEY hover in the door of the service elevator.  Gene reaches down and snags the card key at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HALL OFFICER has to move his table aside so Irene can pass with the cart. As he turns,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY pushes GENE across the hall to the door of the Gover bedroom. The Service Elevator door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALL OFFICER turns quickly at the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE holds totally still in the alcove outside her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALL OFFICER looks suspiciously, and finally sits back do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE uses the key to let himself into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit only by a bedside lamp. ELEANOR GRANT is laying on th bed, dressed, towel across her eyes, bare feet elevated o pair of pillows. GENE edges over slowly to her. He stands over her, not knowing how to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT lifts a hand, moves the towel from her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits upright, reaches for the phone! GENE moves, putt his hand on top of hers on top of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other for a beat. She bolts for the door! Gene beats her to it! She backs u to the bed. Eleanor Grant is a strong, tough woman, but she's not  fearless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Grant, Governor...I won't hurt  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My security people are right next  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One loud scream will bring them in  here instantly. You won't get very  far. Think it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were here to hurt you I would  have done it already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's...a comfort to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only you can help me. I'm also sorry  to say, my problem is your problem,  Mrs. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you...in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was because I had this...in my  pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly pulls out the gun. She takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to listen to me. Carefully.  Three lives depend on you listening  very carefully to what I have to  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly as can be) Of course. But suppose we set up an  appointment. I have an important  speech to deliver and you're cutting  into my nap time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very slowly, she moves to the table, lifts the phone ELEA GRANT My assistant, Krista Brooks, takes care of  constituent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista Brooks is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She freezes, slowly replaces the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her die. She was shot. With  this gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The only thing I know  about him is that he works for your  husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your husband works for somebody  else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE glances at the bedside clock. 1:19. He looks back to the Governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An increasingly edgy MR. SMITH is looking at the Men's Ro door. He glances over to OFFICER TRUST who's keeping an e on him. He looks at his watch again, then gets up and hea for the Men's Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH enters. HECTOR is at the urinal. MR. SMITH checks out the feet under the stall. He has to  bend over to check properly. GENE''s shoes, GENE' s pants legs. HECTOR notices MR. SMITH'S actions. MR. SMITH is aware that he's been noticed, but he is very suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HECTOR flushes the urinal. MR. SMITH stays by the stall. He is going to look over th top of the stall. He rises on his tiptoes. But HECTOR is staring at him like he's a pervert. MR. SMITH is suddenly embarrassed. He backs away from the stall. HECTOR washes his hands, watching MR. SMITH in the mirror MR. SMITH leaves. HECTOR dries his hands. He walks over to the stall and kn on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And GUSTINO tosses a Bellboy jacket over the top of the s HECTOR puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Gustino, what takes you so long?  You need to eat more fiber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything to read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the nightstand. 1:21. ELEANOR GRANT sits against the headboard. GENE sits on th edge of the bed, the gun all but forgotten, held loosely his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd listen to you, not  necessarily believe you. You're  telling me my people are in a plot  against me. You're telling me my  husband wants me killed. What do you  expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you. I don't have any  proof. But nothing like this occurs  in a vacuum. You can't be totally  oblivious. You must suspect something.  You're doing things which are making  people angry. People who have been  in power a long time are losing their  jobs. You know them better than me.  How much does it mean to them?  How  far would they go to hang onto it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes go inward, reflecting a vague doubt. GENE sees i hurries to follow up on this possible chink in her armor. Excited by it, he gets up, forgets to cover her so closel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one way to find out for  sure. Try to cancel the last speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, covering  her inner thought) I'd prefer we didn't refer to it as  my last speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the last chance they have for  me to kill you. Try to get out of  it. They won't let you. They can't.  Try to change the schedule and you'll  know I'm right. What have you got to  lose? It comes down to who you trust,  them or me? Test them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it when pistolero's talk of  trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE, across the room looks at the gun in his hand. He ta the plunge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This? I've never even fired one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT'S hand sweeps the lamp off the table, plung the room into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the blackness) Franco! Franco.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE slips out into the hall as the connecting room door  flies open. Light from the other room spills in. FRANCO r in, pulling a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HALL OFFICER jumps from his chair and runs into the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE quickly moves to the Service Elevator and pushes the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT stares up at FRANCO, back-lit by the light  coming from the next room. It gleams off the gun he holds his hand. She stares from the gun up to his hulking frame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Governor!? What's wrong!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I'm afraid I've had a bad dream,  Franco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service elevator opens and GENE rushes out. He hurrie down the dim service corridor. Suddenly an arm snakes out the blackness and grabs him! HUEY steps into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I have to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE keeps moving fast.  HUEY limps to keep up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is about power and you haven't  got any. There's nothing more you  can do. I'm sorry. Thanks for trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY watches him disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH sees the T.V. TECHNICIAN and REPORTER leaving t bar with their equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH looks at the man who has appeared behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the john.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his watch. 1:23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You' oughta learn to relax. I told  you I've got it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time. It's time now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH scowls and heads for the Men's Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A different watch. The minute hand moves to: 1:24. It is MS. JONES'. She is in the driver's seat. She looks  back at LYNN who is trying to amuse herself one way or  another. She checks her gun. She pulls out her walkie-tal puts it on the seat beside her. She starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very far, honey-pie. Not far at  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the van out into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH bursts into the Men's Room. He goes to the stal and lifts his fist to pound on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of there, Mr. Watson! Your time's  up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stall door opens and GENE comes out, zipping up his p He brushes right past MR. SMITH, heads for the door. MR.  SMITH reaches out, grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to wash your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws him against the sinks. GENE washes his hands. M SMITH leans against the sink next to him In the mirror ab the sink, GENE sees the stall door swings open. GUSTINO I huddled in the corner, feet up on the toilet. MR. SMITH  doesn't notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got faith in you, Mr. Watson. I  know you're not just a regular guy,  see, I know that. Even if you don't  know it yourself. Maybe that's why I  picked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE steps between MR. SMITH and the open stall door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I have to do. I'll do  it. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And'they exit the Men's Room. GUSTINO slumps with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other lights have been turned on. ELEANOR GRANT is fixing her hair in the mirror. FRANCO is cleaning up the broken  lamp. There is a perfunctory knock on the hall door and i opens, revealing BRENDAN GRANT. The MYSTERY MAN hovers in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, El, how's the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, locks eyes with the MYSTERY MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, turns back to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lousy. And I have siesta hair. I'm  thinking of canceling the speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an important speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say critical, not that it's any  of my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just another speech in a Tower  of Babel so high that Nimrod himself  would be put to shame. Cancel. Make  my apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mirror she takes note of BRENDAN GRANT and the MYS MAN exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll trot along. Nice to see you,  Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN steps into the room, shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During a campaign every speech is  important. This is free media  exposure. Primetime news coverage  that we couldn't buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, him? Just visiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hings have changed, Brendan. I thought  you understood that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my friend. And he did help you  to get elected, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the broken lamp) What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I broke a lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan steps behind Eleanor and puts his arms around her affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor, please. I'll put it this  way. This speech or a half-dozen  rubber chicken-fund raisers. What do  you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is, besides the headache I've  come down with a little lower  intestinal havoc. Make my apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, El, you're a trooper. I'll  get you some Pepto, you'll make one  of your patented tributes to the  common person, then back to  Sacramento. This is no time to lay  down on the job. I don't care what  the polls say, you can't afford to  relax. Look what happened to Bush.  Tell you what, if you want to blow  off the Sacramento speech, fine. But  do this one and we'll get out of the  smog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT looks at him, almost sadly. She steps towar the dressing table to fix her hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want to make some changes. Get  Krista in here right away won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN looks at her for a beat, then snaps his fingers l he just remembered something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, gee. I sent her on an errand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent my assistant on an errand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to look  sheepish) I've been a bad boy.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It was not what she wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith pushes Gene toward the escalators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All sorts of MEDIA PEOPLE hover around, CAMPAIGN WORKERS  wearing political buttons and REGULAR FOLKS round out the crowd. People are eating, drinking, and talking. There are a couple of bars, one at each end of the room.  Dessert tables are strategically placed around the room. the speaker's platform at one end is a podium with some c arranged behind it. One of the POLITICO'S takes the podium microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, gentlemen, it is my great  pleasure to introduce to you the  esteemed spouse of our Governor.  Let's give a big L.A. welcome to Mr.  Brendan Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd applauds warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE and MR. SMITH move down the hall, following the sign to the California Ballroom. The entrance to it looms ahea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN GRANT at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the press,  campaign volunteers, and those of  you who were looking for any excuse  to take off work for the afternoon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polite laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE is pushed up to the doorway where he is met by our  friend, the SECURITY MAN with the metal detector. He give MR. SMITH a nod over GENE's shoulder and sends GENE to jo the crowd beyond.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW THROUGH CAMERA
dialogues.text: The Video Camera clumsily tracks past the CROWD, and come tosettle on GENE who is walking into the room, not quite  sure where he is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have with us today the first woman  Governor of our great state...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE is pushing forward into the crowd. He looks back, se surprised, begins turning, searching for someone as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governor Eleanor Samara Grant. What  can I say about her....that won't  get me in trouble when I get home  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter. Lose the video camera effect.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: GENE, in the midst of the crowd, can't locate MR. SMITH.  Confusion clouds his face. He finds himself near the T.V.TECHNICIAN from the bar. Th TECHNICIAN is talking into a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. Charlie. Charlie, are you  reading me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets nothing but static. GENE's eyes move to the back the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a woman who loves our great  state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie... (gives it up) I can't get shit on this stupid radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks up to a spotlight booth set up in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brilliant legislator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE sees the GLINT of something. A gun? His eyes widen. that MR SMITH there? He looks from the spotlight booth to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who will soon win her second term  as the greatest Governor California  has ever seen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's going to ave to run down  to the truck. Tell them this radio's  fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks away from the stage and locks eyes with OFFICE TRUST. He's at the front of the ballroom to one side of t speaker's platform. OFFICER TRUST stares at GENE like a hungry wolf, clutchin his gun in his pocket. They both hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get through. Walkie-Talkies  don't work from here. There's too  much concrete and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realization floods GENE'S eyes. He looks back at Mr. Smit in he booth.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SMITH
dialogues.text: The camera pans along the barrel of the weapon until it c to Mr. Smith who is settling into firing position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin's getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER TRUST, presses forward, hand in pocket. Gene is h target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am honored to present to you our  esteemed Governor and my beloved  wife, Eleanor Samara Grant!

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts in .applause and cheering as ELEANOR GRA comes from the rear of the auditorium and begins to work way down the center aisle. She waves and nods to all the  lyal supporters who surround her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ballons are released above her onto the center of the flo

dialogues.speaker: WAITER-GUSTINO
dialogues.text: He is pushing a large high cart filled with hundreds of  finished plates back towards the kitchen area.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: GENE looks at Mr. Smith and Officer Trust and the impendi disaster. He has to do something...anything...NOW! GENE begins frantically clawing his way toward the podium

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is lost in the uproar. Fighting to be heard above the noise: GENE clawing forward, screaming hopelessly. He pulls the out.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR GRANT
dialogues.text: She spots Gene in the crowd, pushing toward her, gun draw Her eyes widen in fear. BRENDAN GRANT follows her gaze. His eyes widen in somethi other than fear. GENE aims his gun at the ceiling and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium.  Total chaos. People scattering. The Gun in the booth swings from Gene to ELEANOR GRANT. Mr. Smith fires, but his target is blocked by a panicked  guest who is hit. From behind her, FRANCO runs to protect ELEANOR GRANT as  more gunfire erupts. Mr. Smith's aim is clear and he pulls...BAM!  BAM! FRANCO is hit in the center of the back and in the should He falls onto ELEANOR GRANT and they both fall down hard the steps. Blood is everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: He looks over and sees ELEANOR GRANT, beneath FRANCO, loo very dead. He careens toward a door.

dialogues.speaker: PODIUM
dialogues.text: On the dais, BRENDAN GRANT crawls over to where FRANCO la half on top of ELEANOR GRANT. They are both still, eyes  closed. BRENDAN looks down at his wife's face, splattered with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, he did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Governor suddenly and violently gasps for breath.  He eyes snap open and burn into BRENDAN. She has heard her w suspicions confirmed. BRENDAN'S a great liar, but even he can't hide the shock fear on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE bursts through a door. He is followed speedily by OF TRUST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His attack is interrupted by a noise from the darkness. T HUGE DISH PLATE CART, fully loaded, comes flying toward t pushed by GUSTINO. The cart smashes into OFFICER TRUST,  throwing him against a wall, dishes clatter and smash. GENE raises a hand to the darkness and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dais. FRANCO takes a shuddering breath. ELEANOR GRANT pulls herself free, leans over him. She rips opens his sh revealing a slightly-used bullet-proof vest with a bullet hole that missed the vest and hit his upper arm. His eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Franco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (painfully) I'd be better if they'd put sleeves  on these damn vests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his face, looks over to where her husband sta Their eyes lock. It's curtains for BRENDAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls into a waiting area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huey turns and spots a van arriving outside the hotel. He realizes who it could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE 'bangs out of a door, comes to a failing and sees: MR. SMITH has reached the spiral stairway. He starts down it, two and three steps at a time. GENE moves along the railing. MR. SMITH is a whole floor below him. He looks up, sees G and lifts the walkie-talkie to his mouth. GENE pockets the gun climbs the parapet. And jumps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE lands right on top of MR. SMITH. The walkie-talkie f over the railing and into the water of the central founta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the walkie talkie) It's time....You read me?  I don't  hear from you I'm going ahead now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. SMITH and GENE roll down the steps, fighting. MR. SMI basically beats the crap out of him and gets up to contin on. GENE somehow pulls himself up and tackles MR. SMITH. gets in a few lucky shots before MR. SMITH overpowers him beats him again finally .sending him flying into the foun pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS JONES looks to the back seat at LYNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you keep looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job. I'm your babysitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they talk MS. JONES screws a silencer on her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big girl, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a big girl but I'm not a  baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS JONES turns to face LYNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surprise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask too many questions. You want  the surprise or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN closes her eyes. MS. JONES makes to do the deed. Suddenly, HUEY appears behind her at the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, madam. Hello there,  little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a crumpled up newspaper he begins vigorously rubbing the window. LYNN's eyes pop open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, what are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just giving you the gift of a clean  windshield. Only cost you a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want my windshield cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just think you don't want your  windshield cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know I don't want it cleaned.  Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be like that. Think of me as  the Moses of dirty windshields leading  you through the desert of dead bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last time, I don't want it  cleaned. Now get the hell out of  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already done. I've already done  it. You have to pay me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to pay you nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to deny me a lousy dollar  after I've sweated like a pig giving  you the gift of a clean windsheild?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches in the passenger's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is worth a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches the walkie-talkie off the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit! Gimme that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lunges across. HUEY dangles the walkie-talkie before  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we'll have to do better than  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worthless piece of shit! Gimme  that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws open the passenger door, climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY backs away, taunting her with the walkie-talkie. She caught between the van and HUEY, trying to keep her gun u wraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, you fuckin' bum, come  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loses it, hauls out her cannon.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: HUEY's leg is shot out from under him. He ends up on his  back. MS. JONES swoops down on him, trying to grab the wa talkie..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUEY's wounded leg is twisted under him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn is terrified by the gunfire and looks for someplace go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. Jones jumps on the wounded HUEY who is stunned but br clutches the Walkie Talkie under him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, give it to me, you  Sunnavabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sticks the gun in HUEY's face. He tries to take it aw from her, but she's really tough...and mad.  The gun fire wildly, hitting a passing vehicle which careens left caus a chain reaction of COLLISIONS on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN tries to open the van door to escape. The van's door flies open. MR. SMITH stands there, gun in hand.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy blew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points the gun. Lynn jumps back in terror and clambers back in the van.  She goes over the seat as he FIRES... The back window SHATTERS. MR SMITH steps inside the van a step and aims over the se This time he won't miss. LYNN has nowhere to hide.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: But it isn't his gun firing. He stands, staring surprised wide-eyed. He pivots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and stares at GENE, soaking wet, holding the gun. MR.  SMITH'S gun slides from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good...Mr. Watson. I told  them...I could make a killer out of  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops to his knees, pauses, then tree-falls onto his f

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: He rushes forward into the van and reaches over the seat pick Lynn up.

dialogues.speaker: MS JONES AND HUEY
dialogues.text: She has heard the gunfire and turns her attention from HU to GENE. She raises her gun and aims at GENE and LYNN ins the van. HUEY reaches down, grabs his ankle and pulls his shattere artificial leg out of the pants-leg and applies it to the side of her head. She is knocked aside and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing like a good wing- tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At HUEY's shoe-shine stand, GENE and HUEY sit in the shoe shining chairs. They are variously bandaged. LYNN is on G lap. She clings to him, .her face buried against him. They are guarded by COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENE looks at his wrist, gives an ironic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost my watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hub bub catches their attention.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY AREA-BELOW
dialogues.text: A handcuffed BRENDAN GRANT is lead out by STATE POLICE. P flock around them - shouting questions. ELEANOR GRANT watches her husband taken out. The PRESS descends on her like ducks on bread crumbs.  Questions litter the air like confetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any comment at this time would be  most premature. Please, we'll have  something for you in a couple of  hours. Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT finally makes her way toward GENE. COPS kee the PRESS back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT looks at GENE for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...1 would like to...thank you,  Mister Wat... Gene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would also like to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For not believing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I don't blame you. (to LYNN) This is the Governor, Lynn. Say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN lets go of her father with one of her hands, gives a shy little wave. The Governor reaches out, strokes the little girl's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a very brave father, Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dads are like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back to clinging to her father.  Gene looks like might cry he, loves her so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'll get a car to drive  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's... That's OK. We don't  need any help. We'll be just fine.  Won't we, Lynn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN nods. ELEANOR GRANT offers her hand to GENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEANOR GRANT walks away. The PRESS renews their assault. HUEY and GENE look at each other. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LYNN) Come on, kid. I gotta make a phone  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up wearily, carrying his daughter, grabs his  briefcase, and heads away. LYNN peeks back over his shoul at HUEY, shyly waves. HUEY points at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kisses to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN laughs, comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, kisses to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, kisses to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the lobby, GENE's watch lays on the ground. The cr is smashed, the hands stopped. 1:31. A shoe steps on the watch, crushing it further. It belong to the MYSTERY MAN. He stops, checks his perimeters and w slowly toward the exit.
